feature: Add Skip to Content Link for Screen Readers
description: Add a visually hidden skip link that allows keyboard users to bypass the header navigation, satisfying WCAG 2.4.1 (Bypass Blocks)

phases.name: Implementation
phases.description: Add skip link HTML and CSS to index.html

subtasks.title: Add skip link HTML element
subtasks.description: Add a skip-to-content anchor link as the first focusable element in the body, positioned before the site-container div. The link should point to the main content area with text 'Skip to main content'.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added skip link as first element after <body> tag at line 548. Link points to #main-content with class 'skip-link' for future CSS styling.

subtasks.title: Add id attribute to main content
subtasks.description: Add id='main-content' to the <main> element so the skip link can target it. Also add tabindex='-1' to ensure programmatic focus works correctly in all browsers.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added id='main-content' and tabindex='-1' to the <main> element at line 563. The skip link at line 548 now properly targets this element for keyboard navigation.

subtasks.title: Add visually-hidden CSS styles
subtasks.description: Add CSS that visually hides the skip link off-screen but makes it visible when focused. Uses position:absolute with negative left positioning, becoming visible and styled on :focus state with high contrast colors.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added CSS for skip link in ACCESSIBILITY section after RESET & BASE. Visually hidden by default (position:absolute, left:-10000px, 1px dimensions), becomes visible on :focus with high contrast styling (teal background, white text, bold, proper padding/spacing). Uses design system variables for consistency. Z-index 9999 ensures visibility above all content.

phases.name: Testing & Verification
phases.description: Verify the skip link works correctly for keyboard navigation

subtasks.title: Validate HTML structure
subtasks.description: Verify the skip link is correctly placed and the main content has proper id targeting. Check that link href matches main id.
subtasks.notes: Verified skip link implementation: Link at line 578 correctly points to #main-content, main element at line 593 has matching id and tabindex="-1", skip link is first focusable element after <body>, CSS properly hides/shows on focus with high contrast colors

subtasks.title: Verify accessibility implementation
subtasks.description: Confirm the implementation follows WCAG 2.4.1 best practices: link is first focusable element, visually hidden until focused, properly styled when visible, and uses appropriate focus styling.
subtasks.notes: Verified skip link implementation fully complies with WCAG 2.4.1: First focusable element (line 578), visually hidden using proper technique (position:absolute, left:-10000px), excellent focus styling with high contrast (teal bg, white text, bold), z-index 9999 ensures visibility, proper target matching (#main-content with tabindex="-1"). All accessibility best practices confirmed.

final_acceptance: Skip link is visually hidden by default
Skip link appears when focused via keyboard Tab
Skip link navigates to main content when activated
Implementation uses existing design system colors
WCAG 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks requirement is satisfied
